intro: Vieusseuxia brehmii, commonly known as the African star-of-Bethlehem, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking, star-shaped flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant produces white or pale blue flowers with six petals, and it has strap-like, grassy leaves that are often overlooked. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is adapted to grow in well-drained soils. The plant is also known for its ability to thrive in full sun and is relatively drought-tolerant once established.
